body_html:
I'm running into the same issue on 1.2 (not the rc), but I discovered that turning off the bias gets it to work:

xinput = tensorflow.placeholder(tensorflow.float32,shape=[None,16,8,4,128])
tensorflow.layers.conv3d_transpose(xinput, kernel_size=3, padding='SAME', strides=(2,2,2),   filters=32,activation=tensorflow.nn.relu, use_bias=False)
# produces : 
# <tf.Tensor 'conv3d_transpose_10/Relu:0' shape=(?, 32, 16, 8, 32) dtype=float32>
tensorflow.layers.conv3d_transpose(xinput, kernel_size=3, padding='SAME', strides=(2,2,2), filters=32,activation=tensorflow.nn.relu, use_bias=True)
# produces:
# TypeError: Failed to convert object of type <class 'list'> to Tensor. Contents: [None, 512, 8, 32]. Consider casting elements to a supported type.
body_text:
I'm running into the same issue on 1.2 (not the rc), but I discovered that turning off the bias gets it to work:
xinput = tensorflow.placeholder(tensorflow.float32,shape=[None,16,8,4,128])
tensorflow.layers.conv3d_transpose(xinput, kernel_size=3, padding='SAME', strides=(2,2,2),   filters=32,activation=tensorflow.nn.relu, use_bias=False)
# produces : 
# <tf.Tensor 'conv3d_transpose_10/Relu:0' shape=(?, 32, 16, 8, 32) dtype=float32>
tensorflow.layers.conv3d_transpose(xinput, kernel_size=3, padding='SAME', strides=(2,2,2), filters=32,activation=tensorflow.nn.relu, use_bias=True)
# produces:
# TypeError: Failed to convert object of type <class 'list'> to Tensor. Contents: [None, 512, 8, 32]. Consider casting elements to a supported type.
body:
I'm running into the same issue on 1.2 (not the rc), but I discovered that turning off the bias gets it to work:

    xinput = tensorflow.placeholder(tensorflow.float32,shape=[None,16,8,4,128])
    tensorflow.layers.conv3d_transpose(xinput, kernel_size=3, padding='SAME', strides=(2,2,2),   filters=32,activation=tensorflow.nn.relu, use_bias=False)
    # produces : 
    # <tf.Tensor 'conv3d_transpose_10/Relu:0' shape=(?, 32, 16, 8, 32) dtype=float32>
    tensorflow.layers.conv3d_transpose(xinput, kernel_size=3, padding='SAME', strides=(2,2,2), filters=32,activation=tensorflow.nn.relu, use_bias=True)
    # produces:
    # TypeError: Failed to convert object of type <class 'list'> to Tensor. Contents: [None, 512, 8, 32]. Consider casting elements to a supported type.
